messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Unschooling group for Dads
messages.msgSnippet: -=- Just clicked on to this group to read the description before mentioning it to my husband and I see that all the messages and individual bios can be read
messages.messageBody:
-=- Just clicked on to this group to read the description before mentioning
it to my husband and I see that all the messages and individual bios can be
read without joining. Perhaps some "dads" might not be aware of that.
grace >>


<< Guh, My husband is new to running a yahoo group. I'll tell him. Thanks
saying something.>>


It's a legit way to set a group up. It's one of the toggle-options, to let
people read without joining. Maybe he really did intend to do that.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Unschooling group for Dads
messages.msgSnippet: Shahram said he went in and finally found where the problem was and fixed it.  I went to the site and couldn t see any messages, so I guess it is fixed now.
messages.messageBody:
Shahram said he went in and finally found where the problem was and fixed it. I went to the site and couldn't see any messages, so I guess it is fixed now.

Nichole

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Unschooling group for Dads
messages.msgSnippet: It s for dads who are unschooling AND dads with fears, etc.... Shahram said there are almost 20 on the list already and some pretty experienced folks,
messages.messageBody:
It's for dads who are unschooling AND dads with fears, etc....

Shahram said there are almost 20 on the list already and some pretty experienced folks, including Ben Lovejoy, your husband, and Jim Tullos.

:o)
Nichole
----- Original Message -----
From: SandraDodd@...
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, October 06, 2004 10:50 AM
Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Unschooling group for Dads



In a message dated 10/4/04 10:49:20 AM, ms_fausey@... writes:

<<
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/UnschoolingDads/


Description
This group is for dads who are unschooling and for dads who have
doubts, questions, fears about it. >>

So. . .

If they're all dads with doubts and fears, who will encourage and reassure
them?

Is it pre-populated by dads without doubts?

Sandra
